statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Va. Commonwealth 77, James Madison 61
article.story: HARRISONBURG, Va. (AP) -- B.A Walker scored 24 points as Virginia Commonwealth beat Colonial Athletic Association rival James Madison 77-61 Saturday night. Three different Dukes players hit 3-pointers in the first four minutes as James Madison (4-9, 1-2) took a six-point lead. The Rams answered with eight straight to go up 18-16 with 12:13 left in the half and they never trailed again. A 3-pointer by Colbey Santos brought the Dukes to within one with 2:56 to go before halftime, but Michael Anderson sank four straight free throws to put the Rams up 31-26 at the break. Walker scored nine points in the first 5½ minutes of the second half as the Rams extended their lead to eight at 44-36. Pierre Curtis hit a jumper with 12:33 remaining, but the Dukes went nine minutes before scoring another field goal. During that time, the Rams went on a 16-2 run that put the game out of reach at 69-48 with 3:53 left to play. Virginia Commonwealth (11-3, 3-0) could get no closer than 15 the rest of the way. Walker and Jesse Pellot-Rosa each had four 3-pointers. Pellot-Rosa finished with 12 points, Eric Maynor had 10 and Wil Fameni added 10 points and 10 rebounds. Terrance Carter led James Madison with 17. Santos made 5 of 6 from 3-point range for 15 points, and Curtis added 12. The Rams have won the last four meeting in the series.
